intro: Erythranthe dentiloba, commonly known as the Sierra daisy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine regions. Erythranthe dentiloba is adapted to harsh environments and is an important component of high-elevation ecosystems.
